igt.tag-types: L L B B B B M M M M B M B B B B G T

tier.item: (1) Wolfgang hat während des letzten Sommers in keinem Monat an jedem Sonntag
Tennis gespielt.
I would like to thank Graham Katz, Uli Sauerland, Magdalena Scheiner, and an anonymous referee for criticism
and helpful comments. Many thanks to Angela Cook for checking my English.
v.Stechow Draft:
Wolfgang has during the last summer in no month on every Sunday tennis played
`For no month last summer did Wolfgang play tennis every Sunday.'
(1) Wolfgang hat während des letzten Sommers in keinem Monat an jedem Sonntag
Tennis gespielt.
I would like to thank Graham Katz, Uli Sauerland, Magdalena Scheiner, and an anonymous referee for criticism
and helpful comments. Many thanks to Angela Cook for checking my English.

Wolfgang hat während des letzten Sommers in keinem Monat an jedem Sonntag Tennis gespielt.
Wolfgang has during the last summer in no month on every Sunday tennis played

For no month last summer did Wolfgang play tennis every Sunday.
(8) Heute hat Ede eine Pizza gegessen.
Today has Ede a pizza eaten.
`Today, Ede ate a pizza.'
(8) Heute hat Ede eine Pizza gegessen.
Today has Ede a pizza eaten.
`Today, Ede ate a pizza.'
Heute hat Ede eine Pizza gegessen.
Today has Ede a pizza eaten.
Today, Ede ate a pizza.

igt.tag-types: L B B B B M M M B M B B B B G T T+AC

tier.item: (22) Das Telefon hat letzte Woche jeden Tag zwischen zwei und drei geklingelt.
A very similar statement of this principle is found in chapter four of Ernst (1998).
v.Stechow Draft:
The phone has last week every day between two and three rung.
`The phone rang every day between two and three last week.'
(22) Das Telefon hat letzte Woche jeden Tag zwischen zwei und drei geklingelt.
A very similar statement of this principle is found in chapter four of Ernst (1998).
v.Stechow Draft:
The phone has last week every day between two and three rung.
`The phone rang every day between two and three last week.'
Das Telefon hat letzte Woche jeden Tag zwischen zwei und drei geklingelt.
A very similar statement of this principle is found in chapter four of Ernst (1998).
v.Stechow Draft:
The phone has last week every day between two and three rung.
The phone rang every day between two and three last week.
(24) Das Telefon hat in keiner Woche jeden Tag geklingelt.
The phone has in no week each day rung.
`The phone hasn't rung every day in any (one) week.'
(24) Das Telefon hat in keiner Woche jeden Tag geklingelt.
The phone has in no week each day rung.
`The phone hasn't rung every day in any (one) week.'
Das Telefon hat in keiner Woche jeden Tag geklingelt.
The phone has in no week each day rung.
The phone hasn't rung every day in any (one) week.
(25) Wolfgang hat nach Leas Geburt an jedem Abend ein Bier getrunken.
Wolfgang has after Lea's birth on every evening a beer drunk.
`After Lea's birth, Wolfgang drank a beer every evening.'
(25) Wolfgang hat nach Leas Geburt an jedem Abend ein Bier getrunken.
Wolfgang has after Lea's birth on every evening a beer drunk.
`After Lea's birth, Wolfgang drank a beer every evening.'
Wolfgang hat nach Leas Geburt an jedem Abend ein Bier getrunken.
Wolfgang has after Lea's birth on every evening a beer drunk.
After Lea's birth, Wolfgang drank a beer every evening.
(91) Jane rief an, nachdem Marie angekommen war/*ankam.
Jane called, after Mary arrived was/*arrived.
`Jane called after Mary (had) arrived.'
(91) Jane rief an, nachdem Marie angekommen war/*ankam.
Jane called, after Mary arrived was/*arrived.
`Jane called after Mary (had) arrived.'
Jane rief an, nachdem Marie angekommen war/*ankam.
Jane called, after Mary arrived was/*arrived.
Jane called after Mary (had) arrived.

(105) Italian:
L'estate scorsa Mario non ha giocato a tennis in nessun mese ogni domenica.
The summer past M. not has played tennis in no month every Sunday.

(108) Wolfgang ha giocato a tennis [in nessun mese [ ogni domenica]]
Wolfgang has played tennis in no month every Sunday
